snippet: Major Internet sites and human rights advocates sharply criticized a proposed law that would grant the Russian government broad new powers to restrict Web content.
abstract: Major Internet sites and human rights advocates sharply criticize a proposed law that would grant the Russian government broad new powers to restrict Web content, ostensibly to protect children from pornography and other harmful material; critics say the law could quickly lead to repression of speech and a restrictive firewall like the one in China.
lead_paragraph: Major Internet sites and human rights advocates sharply criticized a proposed law that would grant the Russian government broad new powers to restrict Web content.

headline.seo: Wikipedia Shuts Site to Protest Bill for Firewall in Russia
headline.main: Bill to Restrict Web Content Is Assailed in Russia
headline.print_headline: Bill to Give Russia’s Government Broad Power to Restrict Web Content Is Criticized
